page.title: 08Home life in Witton
page.content: Witton is an area containing above average size families of 6 or more.The majority of people in this closely knit community are not born in Birmingham. Most families speak an Asian language with little English spoken at home.They listen to ethnic music and watch their own videos in their mother tongue.Most children attend the Mosque every evening from 4-6.30 and at weekends. Very few signs of sexual equality at home exist,with women doing housework and the men decorate.Tarvel is very restricted as most families do not own a car.Few admit to smoking but those who do are in the 40+ age range.In most cases hobbies are limited to those confined within the home.Cats form the majority of the few pets owned.The main sources of reading matter are the daily papers and the majority of readers are in the 5-11 and 23-50 age ranges.
